intro: Parathesis panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian parathesis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture.
